snippet: Pandora is squaring off against Ascap in a closely watched trial over royalty payments determined by a system developed long before digital streams and smartphone apps.
abstract: Music streaming service Pandora is squaring off against music publishers Ascap and BMI in lawsuits that could upend royalty payment system that has been in place since 1941; publishers say archaic regulations have allowed Pandora to make extremely small payments even as it streams music to millions, while Pandora in turn accuses publishers of skirting regulations.
lead_paragraph: Pandora is squaring off against Ascap in a closely watched trial over royalty payments determined by a system developed long before digital streams and smartphone apps.

headline.main: Pandora Suit May Upend Century-Old Royalty Plan
headline.print_headline: Pandora Suit May Upend Century-Old Royalty Plan

keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
keywords.name: organizations
